official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the
		  Secretary of Veterans Affairs to pay provisional benefits for certain
		  nonadjudicated claims, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Provisional payment of
			 certain nonadjudicated claims for benefits under the laws administered by the
			 Secretary of Veterans Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

header.#text:
Payment of
				provisional benefits for certain nonadjudicated claims

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is not
				adjudicated before the date that is 125 days after the date of the submittal of
				the claim, the

shall pay to the claimant provisional benefits under
				this section for the period beginning on the date that is 125 days after the
				date of the submittal of the claim and ending on the date on which a final
				decision is made with respect to the claim.

text.#text:
In the case of any
				claim for disability compensation under

The amount of the provisional benefits payable to a
				claimant under this section is an amount equal to the lesser of the
				following:

The average amount
				payable to a person who receives payments of compensation for the type of
				disability for which the claimant submitted the claim.

The amount payable
				to a person who receives payments of compensation for a disability rated at 40
				percent under the schedule for rating disabilities under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reduce the amount owed to the claimant for
				the period between the effective date of the award of the benefits and the date
				of the adjudication of the claim by the amount of provisional benefits paid to
				the claimant under this section.

text.#text:
Upon the adjudication of
				a claim for which the claimant receives payments of provisional benefits under
				this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that there exists in
				connection with the claim an indication of fraud, misrepresentation, or bad
				faith on the part of the
				claimant.

text.#text:
If, upon the adjudication of such a claim,
				the claim is denied or the monthly amount of the disability compensation
				benefits awarded to the claimant is less than the monthly amount of provisional
				benefits paid to the claimant under this section, there shall be no recovery of
				the overpayments unless the

The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter
			 is amended by adding at the end of the items relating to such subchapter the
			 following new item:

toc-entry.#text:
5127. Payment of provisional benefits for
				certain nonadjudicated
				claims.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall apply with respect to a new claim for benefits submitted
			 after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1739 IH: Veterans Backlog Reduction Act
